mods.abstract: So-called kiosk of Trajan at Philae (New Kingdom - Dynasty XVIII). Open papyrus hypaethral Temple built by the Emperor Trajan, most likely to shelter the bark of Isis at the eastern banks of Philae Island (foreground); pylon and Temple complex (background); "80 PHYLAE P. DITTRICH" in white along bottom of print.

titleInfo.title: Nineteenth and Early Twentieth Century Images of Egypt

location.physicalLocation: Frank H. McClung Museum of Natural History and Culture

recordInfo.recordContentSource: Frank H. McClung Museum of Natural History and Culture
